original: Majjhima Nikāya 124
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Bākulasutta
analyzed: bākulasutta
translated: With Bākula

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā bākulo rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: ekam samayam āyasmā bākulaḥ rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: Once the Venerable Bākula was staying in the country of the Magadhans at Dakkhinagiri near the brahmin village of Ekanāḷa.

original: Atha kho acelakassapo āyasmato bākulassa purāṇagihisahāyo yenāyasmā bākulo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā bākulena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho acelakassapaḥ āyasmataḥ bākulassa purāṇagihi sahāyaḥ yena āyasmā bākulaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā bākulena saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the naked ascetic Kassapa, a former classmate of the Venerable Bākula when he was a householder, approached the Venerable Bākula and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho acelakassapo āyasmantaṁ bākulaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho acelakassapaḥ āyasmantam bākulam etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the Venerable Bākula:

original: “Kīvaciraṁ pabbajitosi, āvuso bākulā”ti?
analyzed: kīvaciram pabbajitaḥ asi āvuso bākula ati
translated: “How long has it been, friend Bākula, since you went forth?”

original: “Asīti me, āvuso, vassāni pabbajitassā”ti.
analyzed: asi iti me āvuso vassāni pabbajitassa ati
translated: “Eighty years, friend.”

original: “Imehi pana te, āvuso bākula, asītiyā vassehi katikkhattuṁ methuno dhammo paṭisevito”ti?
analyzed: imehi pana te āvuso bākula asītiyā vassehi katikkhattum methunaḥ dhammo paṭisevito ti
translated: “In those eighty years, friend Bākula, how many times have you taken to the married state?”

original: “Na kho maṁ, āvuso kassapa, evaṁ pucchitabbaṁ:
analyzed: na kho me āvuso kassapa evam pucchitabba
translated: “Friend Kassapa, you should not ask me such a question as that.

original: ‘imehi pana te, āvuso bākula, asītiyā vassehi katikkhattuṁ methuno dhammo paṭisevito’ti.
analyzed: imehi pana te āvuso bākula asītiyā vassehi katikkhattum methunaḥ dhammo paṭisevito ti
translated: You should ask me this: ‘How many times in those eighty years have you experienced the pleasure of sexual intercourse?’”

original: Evañca kho maṁ, āvuso kassapa, pucchitabbaṁ:
analyzed: evam ca kho me āvuso kassapa pucchitabba
translated: And you should ask me about this:

original: ‘imehi pana te, āvuso bākula, asītiyā vassehi katikkhattuṁ kāmasaññā uppannapubbā’”ti?
analyzed: imehi pana te āvuso bākula asītiyā vassehi katikkhattum kāma saññā uppanna pubbā ti
translated: ‘Friend Bākula, in these eighty years, how many times have you had sensual thoughts?’”

original: “Asīti me, āvuso, vassāni pabbajitassa nābhijānāmi kāmasaññaṁ uppannapubbaṁ”.
analyzed: asi iti me āvuso vassāni pabbajitassa na abhijānāmi kāma saññam uppanna pubba
translated: “For eighty years, friend Kassapa, I have not recalled ever having had sensual thoughts.”

original: “Yampāyasmā bākulo asītiyā vassehi nābhijānāti kāmasaññaṁ uppannapubbaṁ idampi mayaṁ āyasmato bākulassa acchariyaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ dhārema”.
analyzed: yam pa āyasmā bākulaḥ asītiyā vassehi na abhijānāti kāma saññam uppanna pubbam idam pi mayam āyasmataḥ bākulassa acchariyam abbhuta dhammam dhārema
translated: “We remember this as a wonderful and marvellous quality of Ven. Bākula’s: that for eighty years he has not recalled ever having had sensual thoughts.”

original: “Asīti me, āvuso, vassāni pabbajitassa nābhijānāmi byāpādasaññaṁ …pe…
analyzed: asi iti me āvuso vassāni pabbajitassa na abhijānāmi byāpāda saññam pe
translated: “For eighty years, friend Kassapa, I have not recalled ever having had thoughts of ill will …

original: vihiṁsāsaññaṁ uppannapubbaṁ”.
analyzed: vihisā saññam uppanna pubba
translated: thoughts of harming.”

original: “Yampāyasmā bākulo asītiyā vassehi nābhijānāti vihiṁsāsaññaṁ uppannapubbaṁ, idampi mayaṁ āyasmato bākulassa acchariyaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ dhārema”.
analyzed: yam pa āyasmā bākulaḥ asītiyā vassehi na abhijānāti vihisā saññam uppanna pubbe idam pi mayam āyasmataḥ bākulassa acchariyam abbhuta dhammam dhārema
translated: “We remember this as a wonderful and marvellous quality of Ven. Bākula’s: that for eighty years he has not recalled ever having had thoughts of harming.”

original: “Asīti me, āvuso, vassāni pabbajitassa nābhijānāmi kāmavitakkaṁ uppannapubbaṁ”.
analyzed: asi iti me āvuso vassāni pabbajitassa na abhijānāmi kāma vitakkam uppanna pubba
translated: “For eighty years, friend Kassapa, I have not recalled ever having had sensual intentions.”

original: “Yampāyasmā bākulo asītiyā vassehi nābhijānāti kāmavitakkaṁ uppannapubbaṁ, idampi mayaṁ āyasmato bākulassa acchariyaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ dhārema”.
analyzed: yam pa āyasmā bākulaḥ asītiyā vassehi na abhijānāti kāma vitakkam uppanna pubbaḥ idam pi mayam āyasmataḥ bākulassa acchariyam abbhuta dhammam dhārema
translated: “We remember this amazing and astounding quality of Venerable Bākula: that for eighty years he doesn’t remember ever having given rise to thoughts of sensual desire.”

original: “Asīti me, āvuso, vassāni pabbajitassa nābhijānāmi byāpādavitakkaṁ …pe…
analyzed: asi iti me āvuso vassāni pabbajitassa na abhijānāmi byāpāda vitakkam pe
translated: “For eighty years since going forth I don’t remember ever having given rise to thoughts of ill will, thoughts of harming,

original: vihiṁsāvitakkaṁ uppannapubbaṁ”.
analyzed: vihisā vitakkam uppanna pubba
translated: or thoughts of sensual desire.”

original: “Yampāyasmā bākulo asītiyā vassehi nābhijānāti vihiṁsāvitakkaṁ uppannapubbaṁ, idampi mayaṁ āyasmato bākulassa acchariyaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ dhārema”.
analyzed: yam pa āyasmā bākulaḥ asītiyā vassehi na abhijānāti vihisā vitakkam uppanna pubbaḥ idam pi mayam āyasmataḥ bākulassa acchariyam abbhuta dhammam dhārema
translated: “We remember this amazing and astounding quality of Venerable Bākula: that for eighty years he doesn’t remember ever having given rise to thoughts of harming.”

original: “Asīti me, āvuso, vassāni pabbajitassa nābhijānāmi gahapaticīvaraṁ sāditā”.
analyzed: asi iti me āvuso vassāni pabbajitassa na abhijānāmi gahapati cīvaram sāditā
translated: “For eighty years since going forth I don’t remember ever having accepted a robe from a householder.”

original: “Yampāyasmā bākulo asītiyā vassehi nābhijānāti gahapaticīvaraṁ sāditā, idampi mayaṁ āyasmato bākulassa acchariyaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ dhārema”.
analyzed: yam pa āyasmā bākulaḥ asītiyā vassehi na abhijānāti gahapati cīvaram sāditā idam pi mayam āyasmataḥ bākulassa acchariyam abbhuta dhammam dhārema
translated: “We remember this amazing and astounding quality of Venerable Bākula: that for eighty years he doesn’t remember ever having accepted a robe from a householder.”

original: “Asīti me, āvuso, vassāni pabbajitassa nābhijānāmi satthena cīvaraṁ chinditā”.
analyzed: asi iti me āvuso vassāni pabbajitassa na abhijānāmi satthena cīvaram chinditā
translated: “For eighty years since going forth I don’t remember ever having cut a robe with a knife.”

original: “Yampāyasmā bākulo asītiyā vassehi nābhijānāti satthena cīvaraṁ chinditā …pe… dhārema”.
analyzed: yampā ayasmā bākulaḥ asītiyā vassehi na abhijānāti satthena cīvaram chinditā pe dhārema
translated: “Venerable Bakkula doesn’t remember cutting a robe with a knife in eighty years.” …

original: “Asīti me, āvuso, vassāni pabbajitassa nābhijānāmi sūciyā cīvaraṁ sibbitā …pe…🔽nābhijānāmi rajanena cīvaraṁ rajitā …🔽nābhijānāmi kathine cīvaraṁ sibbitā …
analyzed: asi iti me āvuso vassāni pabbajitassa na abhijānāmi sūciyā cīvaram sibbitā pe  na abhijānāmi rajanena cīvaram rajitā  na abhijānāmi kathine cīvaram sibbitā
translated: “I don’t remember sewing a robe with a needle in eighty years as a monastic.” …🔽“I don’t remember dyeing a robe with dye in eighty years.” …🔽“I don’t remember sewing a robe on a frame in eighty years.” …

original: nābhijānāmi sabrahmacārīnaṁ cīvarakamme vicāritā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi sabrahmacārīnam cīvara kamme vicāritā
translated: “I don’t remember advising my fellow monastics about robe-making in eighty years.” …

original: nābhijānāmi nimantanaṁ sāditā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi nimantanam sāditā
translated: “I don’t remember accepting an invitation in eighty years.” …

original: nābhijānāmi evarūpaṁ cittaṁ uppannapubbaṁ:
analyzed: na abhijānāmi evarūpam cittam uppanna pubba
translated: “I don’t remember ever having the thought,

original: ‘aho vata maṁ koci nimanteyyā’ti …🔽nābhijānāmi antaraghare nisīditā …🔽nābhijānāmi antaraghare bhuñjitā …
analyzed: aho vata mam koci nimanteyya ati  na abhijānāmi antaraghare nisīditā  na abhijānāmi antaraghare bhuñjitā
translated: ‘Oh, I hope someone invites me.’ …🔽“I don’t remember sitting in a house in eighty years.” …🔽“I don’t remember eating in a house in eighty years.” …

original: nābhijānāmi mātugāmassa anubyañjanaso nimittaṁ gahetā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi mātugāmassa nimittam
translated: “I don’t remember observing the bodily signs of a woman in eighty years.” …

original: nābhijānāmi mātugāmassa dhammaṁ desitā antamaso catuppadampi gāthaṁ …🔽nābhijānāmi bhikkhunupassayaṁ upasaṅkamitā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi mātugāmassa dhammam desitā antamasaḥ catuppadam pi gātham  na abhijānāmi bhikkhu upassayam upasaṅkamitā
translated: “I don’t remember teaching a woman a teaching in eighty years, even just a four-line verse.” …🔽“I don’t remember visiting the nuns’ dwelling place in eighty years.” …

original: nābhijānāmi bhikkhuniyā dhammaṁ desitā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi bhikkhuniyā dhammam desitā
translated: “I don’t remember teaching a nun a teaching in eighty years.” …

original: nābhijānāmi sikkhamānāya dhammaṁ desitā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi sikkhamānāya dhammam desitā
translated: I don’t recall ever teaching the Teaching to a trainee nun. …

original: nābhijānāmi sāmaṇeriyā dhammaṁ desitā …🔽nābhijānāmi pabbājetā …🔽nābhijānāmi upasampādetā …🔽nābhijānāmi nissayaṁ dātā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi sāmaṇeriyāḥ dhammam desitā  na abhijānāmi pabbājetā  na abhijānāmi upasampādetā  na abhijānāmi nissayam dātā
translated: I don’t recall ever teaching the Teaching to a novice nun. …🔽I don’t recall ever giving the going forth. …🔽I don’t recall ever giving the full ordination. …

original: nābhijānāmi sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpetā …🔽nābhijānāmi jantāghare nhāyitā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpetā  na abhijānāmi jantāghare
translated: I don’t recall ever giving formal support. …🔽I don’t recall ever looking after a novice monk. …🔽I don’t recall ever bathing in a sauna. …

original: nābhijānāmi cuṇṇena nhāyitā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi cuṇṇena nhāyitā
translated: I don’t recall ever bathing with a bath powder. …

original: nābhijānāmi sabrahmacārīgattaparikamme vicāritā …🔽nābhijānāmi ābādhaṁ uppannapubbaṁ, antamaso gaddūhanamattampi …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi sabrahmacārī gatta parikamme vicāritā  na abhijānāmi ābādham uppanna pubba antamasaḥ gaddūhana mattam pi
translated: I don’t recall ever being involved in the work of the Sangha of nuns. …🔽I don’t recall ever having an illness, not even a headache. …

original: nābhijānāmi bhesajjaṁ upaharitā, antamaso haritakikhaṇḍampi …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi bhesajjam upaharitāḥ antamasaḥ
translated: I don’t recall ever taking medicine, not even a myrobalan fruit. …

original: nābhijānāmi apassenakaṁ apassayitā …
analyzed: na abhijānāmi a passenakam a passayitā
translated: I don’t recall ever being treated by a bone-setter. …

original: nābhijānāmi seyyaṁ kappetā”.
analyzed: na abhijānāmi seyyam kappetā
translated: I don’t recall ever preparing a bed.”

original: “Yampāyasmā …pe… dhārema”.
analyzed: dhārema
translated: “You should remember it as such.”

original: “Asīti me, āvuso, vassāni pabbajitassa nābhijānāmi gāmantasenāsane vassaṁ upagantā”.
analyzed: asi iti me āvuso vassāni pabbajitassa na abhijānāmi gāmanta senāsane vassam upagantā
translated: “I’ve been a monastic for eighty years, but I don’t recall ever entering the rainy-season residence in a village dwelling.”

original: “Yampāyasmā bākulo asītiyā vassehi nābhijānāti gāmantasenāsane vassaṁ upagantā, idampi mayaṁ āyasmato bākulassa acchariyaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ dhārema”.
analyzed: yam pa āyasmā bākulaḥ asītiyā vassehi na abhijānāti gāmanta senāsane vassam upagantā idam pi mayam āyasmataḥ bākulassa acchariyam abbhuta dhammam dhārema
translated: “We also remember this amazing and astounding quality of Venerable Bākula: that he doesn’t remember ever having entered the rains residence in a village for eighty years.”

original: “Sattāhameva kho ahaṁ, āvuso, saraṇo raṭṭhapiṇḍaṁ bhuñjiṁ;
analyzed: satta aham eva kho aha āvuso saraṇaḥ raṭṭha piṇḍam bhuñji
translated: “For seven days I ate the almsfood of the country of Setavyā,

original: atha aṭṭhamiyaṁ aññā udapādi.
analyzed: atha aṭṭhamiyam aññā udapādi
translated: and on the eighth day I became fully awakened.🔽We also remember this amazing and astounding quality of Venerable Bākula: that he ate the almsfood of the country of Setavyā for seven days,

original: Yampāyasmā bākulo sattāhameva saraṇo raṭṭhapiṇḍaṁ bhuñji; atha aṭṭhamiyaṁ aññā udapādi idampi mayaṁ āyasmato bākulassa acchariyaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ dhārema.
analyzed: yampa āyasmā bākulo satta aham eva saraṇaḥ raṭṭha piṇḍam bhuñji atha aṭṭhamiyam aññā udapādi idam pi mayam āyasmataḥ bākulassa acchariyam abbhuta dhammam dhārema
translated: and on the eighth day he became fully awakened.

original: Labheyyāhaṁ, āvuso bākula, imasmiṁ dhammavinaye pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.🔽Alattha kho acelakassapo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: labheyya āha āvuso bākulaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye pabbajja labheyyam upasampadanti  alattha kho acelakassapaḥ imasmin dhammavinaye pabbajja alattha upasampada
translated: May I receive the going forth in this Dhamma and Discipline, may I receive the full ordination?”🔽And the wanderer Kassapa received the going forth in this Dhamma and Discipline, he received the full ordination.

original: Acirūpasampanno panāyasmā kassapo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto
analyzed: acira upasampannaḥ pana ayasmā kassapaḥ ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ ātāpī pahitattaḥ viharantaḥ
translated: Soon after his full ordination, while staying in the Wild Mango Grove,

original: nacirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ
analyzed: kula puttā sammat eva agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajanti tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosāna
translated: and not long afterwards, dwelling alone, withdrawn, diligent, ardent, and resolute,

original: diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
analyzed: diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: he directly experienced the supreme culmination of the spiritual life for which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: He understood: “Birth is destroyed, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.”

original: Aññataro kho panāyasmā kassapo arahataṁ ahosi.
analyzed: aññataraḥ kho pana ayasmā kassapaḥ arahatam ahosi
translated: And the venerable Kassapa became another of the arahants.

original: Atha kho āyasmā bākulo aparena samayena avāpuraṇaṁ ādāya vihārena vihāraṁ upasaṅkamitvā evamāha:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā bākulaḥ aparena samayena avāpuraṇam ādāya vihārena vihāram upasaṅkamitvā evam āha
translated: Then, after some time, the venerable Bakkula took a key and, going from dwelling to dwelling, said to the bhikkhus:

original: “abhikkamathāyasmanto, abhikkamathāyasmanto. Ajja me parinibbānaṁ bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: abhikkamatha ayasmantaḥ abhikkamatha ayasmantaḥ ajja me parinibbānam bhavissati iti
translated: “Come out, venerable sirs, come out! Today I will attain final Nibbana.”

original: “Yampāyasmā bākulo avāpuraṇaṁ ādāya vihārena vihāraṁ upasaṅkamitvā evamāha: ‘abhikkamathāyasmanto,
analyzed: yampā ayasmā bākulaḥ avāpuraṇam ādāya vihārena vihāram upasaṅkamitvā evam āha abhikkamatha ayasmantaḥ
translated: “When the venerable Bakkula took a key and, going from dwelling to dwelling, said to the bhikkhus: ‘Come out, venerable sirs, come out! Today I will attain final Nibbana,’

original: abhikkamathāyasmanto; ajja me parinibbānaṁ bhavissatī’ti, idampi mayaṁ āyasmato bākulassa
analyzed: abhikkamatha āyasmantaḥ ajja me parinibbānam bhavissati iti idam pi mayam āyasmataḥ bākulassa
translated: this was the first wonder that appeared in connection with the venerable Bakkula.

original: acchariyaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ dhārema”.
analyzed: acchariyam abbhuta dhammam dhārema
translated: we will remember it as a wonderful and marvellous quality of the Venerable Bākula.”

original: Āyasmā bākulo majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinnakova parinibbāyi.
analyzed: āyasmā bākulaḥ majjhe bhikkhu saṅghassa nisinnakaḥ uva parinibbāyi
translated: Then, while sitting right there in the midst of the Sangha of bhikkhus, the Venerable Bākula attained final Nibbana.

original: “Yampāyasmā bākulo majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinnakova parinibbāyi, idampi mayaṁ āyasmato bākulassa acchariyaṁ abbhutadhammaṁ dhāremā”ti.
analyzed: yam pa āyasmā bākulaḥ majjhe bhikkhu saṅghassa nisinnakaḥ uva parinibbāyi idam pi mayam āyasmataḥ bākulassa acchariyam abbhuta dhammam dhārema ati
translated: “The fact that the Venerable Bākula attained final Nibbana while sitting right there in the midst of the Sangha of bhikkhus—this too we remember as a wonderful and marvellous quality of the Venerable Bākula.”

original: Bākulasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: bākula suttam niṭṭhitam catuttha
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on Bākula is finished.
